children.value: Strategy modules in Hummingbot are modules that monitor markets and make trading decisions. All strategy classes are derived from the
class, which is derived from the
The concrete strategy classes included with Hummingbot, including
All strategy modules are child classes of
What this means is, a running strategy module is called every second via its

method to check on the markets and wallets then decide whether it should perform any trades or not. So one way to think about it is that a strategy module acts like it's watching a movie frame-by-frame via
, and reacts to what it sees in real time via trading actions.
If you're reading or writing a strategy module, the
function should be treated as the entry point of a strategy module. If you're reading a strategy module's code,
should be where you start. If you're writing a new strategy module,
is also going to start writing the important bits of your strategy.
object may be associated with multiple markets.
class comes with a set of interface functions for handling market events from associated
objects, which may be overridden by child classes to receive and process market events.
The event interface functions are as follows:
A buy order has been created. Argument is a
A sell order has been created. Argument is a
An order has been filled in the market. Argument is a
An order has failed in the market. Argument is a
An order has been canceled. Argument is a
An order has expired. Argument is a
A buy order has been completely filled. Argument is a
A sell order has been completely filled. Argument is a
includes pre-defined logic for creating and canceling trading orders - which are the primary ways for a strategy to interact with associated markets.
It is highly encouraged to use these functions to create and remove orders, rather than calling functions like
objects directly - since the functions from
provides order tracking functionalities as well.

cdef str c_buy_with_specific_market(self,
                                    object market_trading_pair_tuple,
                                    object amount,
                                    object order_type = *,
                                    object price = *,
                                    double expiration_seconds = *
                                    )

cdef str c_sell_with_specific_market(self,
                                     object market_trading_pair_tuple,
                                     object amount,
                                     object order_type = *,
                                     object price = *,
                                     double expiration_seconds = *
                                     )
Creates a buy or a sell order in the market specified by `market_trading_pair_tuple'and returns the order ID string.
object and trading pair to create the order for.
object that specifies the order size in terms of the base asset.
enum specifying the order type. Default value is
object, specifying the price for a limit order. This parameter is ignored if

: an optional number, which specifies how long a limit should automatically expire. This is only used by Ethereum-based decentralized exchanges like Radar Relay, where active order cancellation costs gas. By default, passive cancellation via expiration is used on these exchanges.
Cancels an active order from a market.
object and the trading pair to cancel an order from.
: Order ID string returned from a previous call to order creation functions above.
object comes with an internal attribute
object is responsible for tracking all active and in-flight orders created by the
object, and also all in-flight order cancels.
When writing or modifying a strategy module, you can use the built-in
object to query the active or in-flight orders / cancels you currently have. It's useful for preventing issuing duplicate orders or order cancels.
Below are some of the user functions or properties under
Returns a list of still active limit orders with their market object.
Returns a dictionary mapping from market trading pair tuples to lists of active limit orders.
Returns a list of active limit bid orders, with their market object.
Returns a list of active limit ask orders with their market object.
Returns a list of in-flight or active market orders, with their market object. This is useful for decentralized exchanges where market orders may take a minute to settle due to block delay.
Returns a dictionary of order IDs that are being canceled.
